definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: It was the biggest one-day loss for the Nikkei since 1987.
sentences.chinese: 这是日经指数1987年以来最大单日跌幅。

sentences.english: The Dow lost 508 points in a single day.
The Crash was the greatest single-day loss that Wall Street had ever suffered in continuous trading up to that point.
sentences.chinese: 这次崩溃创下华尔街在连续交易中的单日最大跌幅。

sentences.english: This was the greatest loss Wall Street ever suffered in a single day.
sentences.chinese: 这是华尔街有史以来单日损失最大的一次。

sentences.english: Single flower single day nectar volume and temperature and humidity habitats Tilia no significant correlation.
sentences.chinese: 单花单日泌蜜量与糠椴生境温湿度没有显著的相关性。

sentences.english: Therefore, odd-numbered days' large bounce difficult word to be optimistic.
sentences.chinese: 因此，单日的大幅反弹难言乐观。

sentences.english: It was its second-biggest one-day percentage rise ever.
sentences.chinese: 单日百分比涨幅创下历史第二。

sentences.english: Tuesday's was the fifth-highest percentage gain in the past 12 months.
sentences.chinese: 周二创下了过去12月中第五大单日涨幅。

sentences.english: We didn't imagine the largest one-day drop in the history of mankind.
sentences.chinese: 但我们没有预料到人类历史上单日最大跌幅。

definition: strategic pass/barrier or mark (i.e. a level considered impressive, usually a round figure such as 10,000)/instrument of torture used to break limbs
sum or volume of business transactions/turnover
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word
